page.title: 09The River Eden
page.content: The River Eden starts at{Gateside where several springs and streams form its source at the foot of the {Lomond hills.}It is fed by a number of small burns along its way,and having a very level course it is never very low-not even in summer drought. The Eden's course is between 12 and 14 miles long,and works its way through {the plain of the Howe of Fife.}When it reaches{Pitlessie}it is 9 miles from the sea. Many local people{fish}the river during the fishing season. The fish in the Eden are plentiful and vary from minnows and sticklebacks to trout and salmon.Each year a permit has to be bought to fish the river and it is a very popular{local pastime.
